text: The driver of a motor vehicle shall drive as close to the left hand side of the road as may be expedient, and shall allow all traffic which is proceeding in the opposite direction to pass him on his right hand side.
Except as provided in regulation 3, the driver of a motor vehicle shall pass on the right of all traffic proceeding in the same direction as himself.

The driver of a motor vehicle may pass to the left of a vehicle the driver of which having indicated an intention to turn to the right has drawn to the centre of the road and may pass a tram-car or other vehicle running on fixed rails on either side, provided it is not done in a manner likely to cause danger or inconvenience.

The driver of a motor vehicle shall not pass a vehicle travelling in the same direction as himself if his passing is likely to cause inconvenience or danger to other traffic or where the road ahead is not clearly visible.
The driver of a motor vehicle shall not, when being overtaken or being passed by another vehicle, increase speed or do anything to prevent the other vehicle from passing him.
The driver of a motor vehicle shall slow down when approaching a road intersection or corner and shall not enter until it is safe to do so.
The driver of a motor vehicle shall give way to vehicles on a main road when entering it, and otherwise to all traffic approaching from the right.

When turning to the left, the driver shall drive close to the left-hand side of both roads. When turning to the right, the driver shall draw near to the centre and move so as to pass beyond the intersection point of the centre lines, arriving near the left side of the road entered.

When about to turn to the right or drive to the right-hand side of the road, a driver shall extend his right arm horizontally outside and to the right of the vehicle with the palm of the hand turned to the front.
When about to turn to the left, a driver shall extend his right arm and rotate it in an anti-clockwise direction.
When about to slow down, a driver shall extend his right arm with the palm downward and move it up and down several times to signal to vehicles behind.
When about to stop, a driver shall raise his right forearm vertically outside of and to the right of the vehicle, palm to the front.
When a driver wishes to indicate that the vehicle behind may overtake, he shall extend his right arm horizontally and swing it backward and forward in a semi-circular motion.
Driving a motor vehicle without holding a valid driving licence.
Driving below the age of eighteen years.
Owner of motor vehicle permitting contravention of section 3 or section 4.
Driving a motor vehicle which is not registered.
Driving a transport vehicle which does not carry a valid fitness certificate.
Disobedience of traffic signs, signals, or directions of a police officer engaged in regulation of traffic.
Specifies compensation amounts for death or injury to passengers in public transport, ranging from Rs. 1,000 for loss of teeth to Rs. 16,000 for death.
Lists prior Motor Vehicle Acts from 1939 to 1963 repealed by this enactment, including regional amendment acts in Sindh, NWFP, and West Pakistan.
